p: Nerine huttoniae is a species belonging to the Nerine genus [ 23], which comprises ca. 23 perennial bulbous species native to southern Africa. This Amaryllidacea is a summer growing, evergreen species, and was essentially found in the western part of the Eastern Cape Province of South Africa [ 39, 40]. It was used in folk medicine and in particular by Sotho and Zulu tribes [ 41].
